security_audit.summary: This is a prompt-based documentation skill containing only documentation about development environment setup procedures. No executable code, scripts, or network operations are present. The bash commands shown are illustrative examples in documentation format, not executable code.

content.value_statement: Manual development environment setup is time-consuming and error-prone. This skill automates dependency installation, database initialization, and environment configuration for consistent, reproducible development environments.
actual_capabilities: Checks Java, Node.js, pnpm, Docker, and Docker Compose versions
Installs backend dependencies using Gradle wrapper
Starts PostgreSQL database with Docker Compose
limitations: Does not install runtime dependencies (Java, Node.js, Docker must be pre-installed)
Does not modify system settings or global configurations
Does not handle custom database schemas beyond Flyway migrations
Assumes standard project structure with backend and frontend directories

use_cases.title: Onboard quickly
use_cases.description: Get new developers productive on day one with automated, consistent environment setup

use_cases.title: Standardize environments
use_cases.description: Ensure all team members have identical development environments across machines

use_cases.title: Reduce setup time
use_cases.description: Eliminate manual environment configuration overhead for new project starts

prompt_templates.title: Full setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Set up the complete development environment for this project using the setup-dev-env skill. Include backend dependencies, frontend dependencies, and database setup.

prompt_templates.title: Backend only
prompt_templates.prompt: Set up only the backend development environment. Run Gradle build and verify database connectivity.

prompt_templates.title: Database reset
prompt_templates.prompt: Reset the database environment using Docker Compose and run all Flyway migrations from scratch.

prompt_templates.title: Quick verification
prompt_templates.prompt: Verify the current development environment status. Check all tool versions and confirm dependencies are properly installed.

output_examples.input: Set up the complete development environment
output: Backend: Java 21 confirmed, Gradle dependencies installed, build successful
Frontend: Node.js 20 confirmed, pnpm dependencies installed, build successful
Database: PostgreSQL started, Flyway migrations completed
Ready to start: cd backend && ./gradlew bootRun or cd frontend && pnpm dev

best_practices: Run the skill after cloning a fresh repository to ensure all dependencies are installed
Verify environment variables match between backend/.env and frontend/.env.local
Use the full setup workflow when onboarding new team members
anti_patterns: Running setup without checking pre-installed runtime versions first
Skipping database setup and expecting the application to work
Modifying environment files while the database container is running

faq.question: What tools must be installed before running this skill?
faq.answer: Java 21+, Node.js 20+, pnpm, Docker, and Docker Compose must be pre-installed on your system.

faq.question: Can I run only specific phases of the setup?
faq.answer: Yes, you can specify target parameters for backend-only, frontend-only, database-only, or both configurations.

faq.question: Does this skill modify my global environment settings?
faq.answer: No, this skill only operates within the project directory and does not modify system-wide configurations.

faq.question: Is my data safe when running database migrations?
faq.answer: Flyway migrations run on the Docker PostgreSQL container. Your existing local databases are not affected.

faq.question: What if the build fails during setup?
faq.answer: The skill reports failures at each phase. Common fixes include verifying Java/Node versions and checking Docker is running.

faq.question: How is this different from Docker Compose alone?
faq.answer: This skill orchestrates the entire workflow including dependency installation, builds, migrations, and verification - not just container management.
